edge: Veer-Zaara is the name of a Bollywood movie, and its soundtrack features 11 songs composed by Madan Mohan and revised by his son Sanjeev Kohli.

node_2: music based on old and untouched compositions
edge: The music for Veer-Zaara's soundtrack is based on the old and untouched compositions of Madan Mohan.
Madan Mohan's son, Sanjeev Kohli, revised the music for Veer-Zaara's soundtrack.
The soundtrack of Veer-Zaara was released by YRF Music on September 18, 2004.
The vocals for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack are provided by Lata Mangeshkar.
The vocals for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack are also provided by Jagjit Singh.
The vocals for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack are also provided by Udit Narayan.
The vocals for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack are also provided by Sonu Nigam.
The vocals for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack are also provided by Gurdas Mann.
The vocals for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack are also provided by Roop Kumar Rathod.
The vocals for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack are also provided by Ahmed.
The vocals for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack are also provided by Mohammed Hussain.
The vocals for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack are also provided by Pritha Mazumder.
The lyrics for the songs in Veer-Zaara's soundtrack were written by Javed Akhtar.
